intro: Oplukion afrum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Oplukion afrum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in dry conditions.
